item.title: Dragon Ball Sparking Zero’s New Update Unlocks All Stages for Local Multiplayer
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/dragon-ball-sparking-zeros-new-update-unlocks-all-stages-for-local-multiplayer/

Dragon Ball Sparking Zero’s update Ver.2006.005.003.004.003 is live now. It allows players to access all stages when playing couch coop. 

Previously, when players tried to play local multiplayer in Dragon Ball Sparking Zero, they were restricted to one stage, The Hyperbolic Time Chamber. After the new patch, you can fight against your friends in all of the game’s 12 stages, allowing you to experience high-speed 3D battles with beautiful visuals and destructible environments. 

Balancing Changes in New Sparking Zero Patch

The new Dragon Ball Sparking Zero patch also features several character adjustments; check them out below. 

  • Android 19 and Dr. Gero’s amount of stamina and energy absorbed during a successful throw has been changed. Also, Dragon Dash, rapid ascend, and fast descent will consume energy when using these characters. 
  • Cell 2nd can now throw-escape 
  • Cooler’s transformation now recovers an increased amount of stamina. 
  • Giant characters’ power has been reduced, and the time it takes to charge up smash attacks has been increased. 
  • Great Ape Vegeta and Doctor Willow’s maximum health has been reduced. 
  • Super Vegito’s Final Kamehameha has increased energy consumption and damage dealt.
  • Players can control the trajectory of Son Goku (mini)’s Quick Rush while charging.
  • Lastly, Mr. Satan’s Present Bomb has increased stiffness after activation. 

You can check out the changes and adjustments to functions, battle systems, skills, blasts and more in the full patch notes. Dragon Ball Sparking Zero update Ver.2006.005.003.004.003 was released for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S and Steam. 

In other news, Dragon Ball Sparking Zero’s 90% of sales came from Europe and NA. If you are new to Sparking Zero, check out the Attack, Movement and Defense guides. Also, here are the game’s Episode Battles and Bonus Battles guide hubs. What are your thoughts on Dragon Ball Sparking Zero unlocking all stages for local multiplayer in the latest patch? item.title: Balatro Sells 3.5 Million Units Within the First Year
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/balatro-sells-3-5-million-units-within-the-first-year/

The official Balatro X account (formerly Twitter) revealed that the poker-inspired roguelike deck builder game had sold 3.5 million units. 

Developed by LocalThunk and published by Playstack, Balatro has hit the 3.5 million units sold milestone within its first year of release. In this game, you use unique Joker cards to combine them with valid poker hands to create new possibilities. The title is available on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, Nintendo Switch, and PC. 

Balatro has also introduced several collaborations over the years, featuring unique cards from popular games like Cyberpunk 2077, Among Us, The Witcher, Stardew Valley, and more. Recently, CD Projekt Red repaid the favour by adding a Balatro-themed side quest to Cyberpunk 2077 in its recently released update 2.2. 

In other news, Balatro has managed to generate close to $4.4 million on its mobile version. Also, the developers have promised a major gameplay update in 2025. What are your thoughts on Balatro selling 3.5 million units? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!

item.title: Sony Has Confirmed Their Intent to Acquire Kadokawa Group
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/sony-has-confirmed-their-intent-to-acquire-kadokawa-group/

During a recent interview, Sony Group confirmed its intentions to acquire Kadokawa Group, and the FromSoftware parent company employees seem to be happy about the acquisition. 

Sony Confirms Interest in Acquiring FromSoftware Parent Company 

In a conversation with Yahoo Japan (via IGN), a representative of the Sony Group stated, “It is true that we have expressed our initial intentions. We would appreciate it if you would refrain from commenting further.” This provides official confirmation from both parties that Sony is indeed looking to acquire Kadokawa Group. 

Kadokawa Employees Are Happy about Sony Acquisition

The interview also included comments from a veteran Kadokawa employee who revealed that “other employees are happy about Sony’s acquisition” as they are “dissatisfied with the Natsuno administration”.” The veteran added that the other employees hoped President Natsuno’s employment would be terminated once Sony acquired the company. 

They also provided an example stating that the current administration “did not even hold a press conference when personal information was leaked due to a cyber attack” earlier this year. 

In other news, Sony and Kadokwa have been discussing a potential partnership for years; however, the degree of commitment seems to be the issue. The FromSoftware parent company recently confirmed 20 upcoming console games. item.title: Early Images of Bend Studio’s Potential Next Game Reveal a Brand New Live-Service IP
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/bend-studio-live-serivce-images/

Early images of what could be a new live-service IP by Bend Studio’s have been posted online.

The images came from MP1st, who say that the images came from the portfolio of an undisclosed UI designer at Bend Studio who have been working there since March 2022. According to the outlet, the images originate from a Google Drive that where uploaded sometime in 2023, but it’s unclear on when exactly the images where taken.

They reveal that Bend Studio appears to be working on, or has worked on, some live-service military shooter.

As some people have already pointed out, the one image above appears to be some kind of central hub where players could interact. However, without knowing the full context of the images, it’s possible that this is just a design level for the game, to test out different aspects and isn’t intended for final use.

Job listings have already pointed to Bend Studio’s next game being some kind of live service, and with how the industry has been going all-in with Battle Royales and extraction shooters in the past few years, it isn’t difficult to imagine that Bend Studio could be going in that direction.

For now, though, we’ll have to wait and see what exactly they are developing.

At the time of this writing, Bend Studio’s next game has been in development for four to five years, so we should start to hear more about it soon.
